courseDescription:
Developing apps, regardless of complexity or platform, necessitates coding and UX/UI design. The good news is that App Inventor 2 cuts through this confusion and enables anyone with no programming skills to create Android apps from the ground up for free. This programme includes two graphical user interface (GUI) tools that make creating Android apps simple. The ‘blocks’ designer is a unique tool that allows users to code by dragging object blocks together instead of writing in Java. This graphical user interface considerably speeds up development while providing a perfect platform for teaching people to program. The software translates complicated coding languages into visual drag-and-drop blocks that connect like puzzle pieces. Learn how to use App Inventor's fundamental features, such as the user interface, layout, drawing and animation tools. This course will teach you all you need to know about designing apps without a prior understanding of technical computing.

Do you have a computer that can connect to the internet? Perhaps also a basic understanding of Android applications? Have you already developed a notion for a new app? If you replied 'yes' to any of these questions, you're on track to learning something new. First, you will begin with the layouts of the drawing app's screens in the first module. Next, explore how to use the camera and the image picker media components to programme the button to capture an image and then save it on the phone after it gets pressed. Throughout the module, we will explain the arrangements, the canvas and the slider. The building block segments provide a better understanding of the puzzle programming process that App Inventor 2 employs to develop mobile apps.

By the end of this course, you will have built a sketching Android application from the ground up. While creating the Sketch project from start to end, you will obtain valuable experience with the App Inventor 2 canvas, buttons, arrangement and slider features. Then we will study the block editor to programme activities such as control, processes, logic, maths or variable block. Completion of the course curriculum involves an understanding of the Android marketplace. After understanding how to set up the Google developer interface, you'll receive step-by-step instructions for App publishing. Finally, examine a simple example of submitting APK files to the Google Play Store. Around 3739 new apps are released daily. This course aims to give you a solid foundation for uncomplicated mobile programming, allowing you to launch your apps on the Android market. Put those bright ideas to work and create a one-of-a-kind Android application. Enrol right now!
